metadata.title: CVE-2021-47464 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: audit:fix possible null-pointer dereference in audit_filter_rules Fix possiblenull-pointer dereference in audit_filter_rules. audit_filter_rules() error:we previously assumed 'ctx' could be null

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47464` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
